185696703.review:
I would gladly recommend Disgaea 1 Complete (Available on Nintendo Switch and PS4) to any Disgaea fan who didn't get the chance to play it back in the day or even one who wants to take a trip down memory lane.  This PC port is horrendous.  It's missing all of the QoL updates that the Complete edition got as well as the Afternoon of Darkness content.  The most unfortunate part is the missing QoL updates.  If you have the ability to play Complete instead of this... please do.  It's the far superior version of Disgaea 1.  This port is not good.

That being said, for those that this is their only way to play Disgaea 1... If you are a fan of the more recent Disgaea games but have never played the first few, this could be a rough play.  There were so many QoL additions made in the more recent games that are hard to give up when going back.  I had hundreds upon hundreds of hours in the PS2 version of the game and lived without these, but it's hard this time through.  I've barely even started again and can hardly justify playing this version of the game.

The mouse/keyboard controls are hot garbage.  You can remap the buttons, but that's not the issue.  If you use keyboard only, which took some adjustment for me, it's not terrible once you fix the buttons.  If, however, you want to use the keyboard AND the mouse, you're in for a real frustrating experience for a while.  The controls are very touch-screen friendly and controller friendly, but not kb/m.

The story, while not my favorite in the series, is a nice introduction to the series.  I played this several years after it's initial release but many moons ago now.  I played this before I played any of the others and fell in love with the series based on this story.  It doesn't take itself seriously and it's completely nonsensical, but that's one of the reasons Disgaea fans love the series.  Story is maybe a 6 or 7 out of 10, honestly.

For a player that is new to the series, this is an even harder recommend.  If you are EVER going to play Disgaea 1, I suggest playing it first.  You will, as mentioned before, miss those basic QoL features that are added in the later games.    This game (and the others in the series) is a GRIND!  If you are just looking to complete the story, well to be honest, you're playing the wrong game.  Disgaea isn't about the story.  The story is just what you have to play through to get to the real game.  The post-game is what we're all here for.  Big number gets bigger.  Grind to get number even bigger.

The mechanics, until you understand them, are obtuse.  You can soft lock yourself on a map if you don't understand how Geo panels work.  It's all fixable, but it can be super frustrating to realize that you don't know anything that you were supposed to.  Don't sleep on geo panels and geo chains... they can be your friend. 

The difficulty is... it depends on how well you learned the mechanics.  If you skipped all the dialogue because you were impatient and learned nothing, it will be more challenging.  There are a couple of difficulty spikes that can catch you off guard.  The first "boss," named Mid-Boss in the level can kick your butt if you were playing with a balanced party.  You thought you were doing the right thing, leveling, you know... ALL of your party at a fairly even pace with each other and then you get to this stage (which is SUPER early, btw) and you realize that you suck at the game.  I would be willing to bet that a lot of people quit at that stage and give up on the whole series.  Just know that, if you just grind a little bit, you can get that stage completed.  And get used to that grind... you're going to be doing it A LOT!

It hurts me to not recommend this game, it really does.  But this PC port is trash.  The PC port is the only one I'm not recommending.  I really do recommend Disgaea 1 Complete on the other platforms, though.  If you're a fan of the series, this is where it all started.  It's a very different experience to the newer ones, but a worthwhile trip to the past, for sure.  For new players, do a little research and really understand the level of GRIND and the level of goofy storytelling that this series is known for and if you're still interested, Disgaea 1 is a solid game.  It's not as deep as the later entries, but they were getting their footing with the first couple of entries.

185097661.review:
FUCK THIS GAME 

I hadn't saved for a bit cuz I was getting thought the first area pretty easy. I got to like the last level of the first area. There'e a funny cuteness where the enemy is renamed mid-boss. I dont make the best starting play, whatever. none of my attacks do any more that 5 damage and almost all of my units that can do any damage get killed off in the FIRST TURN from full health to none, i cant revive them or anything and I only have the main character left. i make a half hearted attempt to maybe destroy the geo crystal thingy i break, it nothing happens, i realize im stupid and dont understand the mechanics of the game. the main character dies. i cant do anything with my remaining units. i send them out and just get them killed to like booted back to the hub or something.

that doesn't happen instead the game tries to be funny and the guy named mid boss is like "OH i didnt expect that to happen" and then it plays THE WHOLE FUCKING CREDITS. and then the game is like you can carry your levels it over to your next game or something.

I think i got some like secret ending thing or whatever but like now I have to play completely up to that point. I have a save before that but its from when i was going through the tutorial. 

I get that I lost due to a lack of understanding of the mechanics, but the game didnt give me a second chance or something. part of this is on me, this is an old game so i should have had up to date saves, but like the game was pretty easy up to that point . idk i was enjoying the game up until then and I may still keep playing, but any momentum I had before is kinda gone now

184891516.review:
Resumo:
Este jogo me deixou irritado em alguns momentos, embora tenha uma boa base. Me faz querer jogar as versões mais recentes.

Minha Experiência mais detalhada:

Quero dizer, eu meio que gosto de grind, pelo menos em jogos com uma jogabilidade interessante. Mas esse sistema de turnos simplesmente não me conquistou totalmente. Fiquei animado ao saber que este jogo tem nível 9999 como nível máximo para personagens, armas e acessórios.

Mas upar um clérigo é um saco, embora eu tenha ouvido que eles corrigiram isso na próxima edição?

Além disso, há outras peculiaridades, talvez de jogos japoneses, como não conseguir cancelar um clique acidental em um NPC falante que continua e continua falando sobre algo que você não liga. Quero dizer, graças a Deus (ou aos desenvolvedores) que você pode pular a história nos mapas.

Outra coisa é que estou tendo dificuldade em upar um item para o nível 10. Não sei por que, mas os inimigos já começam no nível 20? Será que acidentalmente encontrei um item de alto nível que só tem residentes e inimigos fortes? Porque, pesquisando, vejo pessoas dizendo que é tranquilo. Vou testar com um item barato e fraco para ver.

Por outro lado: por que eles balanceiam o jogo com base no jogador poder invocar vários heróis em vez de apenas cinco? Isso só faz cada nível demorar um pouco demais se você tentar maximizar o número de personagens. E torna upar cada personagem uma luta, já que cada arma é tão diferente. Isso faz com que os personagens icônicos superem a maioria dos outros personagens invocados. Especialmente porque é muito bom colocar aqueles selos fortes neles.

Duvido que as próximas análises sejam tão detalhadas assim, no entanto.

184888944.review:
Diagaea 1 est un excellent jeu, novateur a l'époque (début PS2), une grande rejouabilité et une excellente durée de vie.

CEPENDANT !!! d'autres titres sont sortis depuis, apportant leur lot d'options qui rendent le jeu plus appréciable. Disgaea 1 date de 2003, Disgaea PC (ce jeu) est sorti en 2016, en 13 ans 4 jeux ont vu le jour entre cet opus et sa version originale, et malheureusement force est de constater que les QOL apportées par les jeux suivants n'ont pas été implémentées dans ce "port" ce qui franchement n'aide pas.

c'est une review positive oui, mais de pas grand chose. l'histoire est très bien, la musique aussi, le gameplay .... faut accrocher mais si on aime le farm ad nauseam on accroche. cela dit en le comparant aux titres suivants de la série, on ne peut que constater a quel point le jeu manque de contenu, même comparé au 2.

Bref un bon jeu mais si vous voulez un meilleur Disgaea pour découvrir la série, je vous conseille le 2, laissez celui ci pour plus tard si vous n’êtes pas sûr d'accrocher au concept, car le jeu est lent, même comparé aux autres.

184638536.review:
[H3]やり込み要素に特化したSRPG[/H3]

全実績解除済み。
クリア時間はかなり人による。クリアだけを目標にしたら10時間程度かもしれない。
日本語UI,音声完備。

人気シリーズ魔界戦記ディスガイア一作目の移植。
昔PSPで途中まで遊んで投げてしまったのを十数年ぶりにクリア。
ディスガイアシリーズといえば数字をどんどんインフレさせるバカゲー寄りのやり込みゲーのイメージだが、キャラクターとストーリーがメチャメチャ良い！
ギャグのノリは少し古いがその空気感に慣れれば現代でも通用する、しっかり感動できるストーリーです。
メインキャラ以外のユニットは拠点でキャラメイクすることで増やすことができる。この際に名前やパラメータの伸び率を割り振ることができ、愛着を持った自分だけのユニットを作れる。
ユニットだけでなく武器自体もレベルを上げられたり、上げたパラメータを他の武器に集約させたり、こだわり次第で際限なく数値を上げることに没頭できる。

現在3を除く1〜7までのシリーズがsteamで販売されている。順番にプレイしたいので、いつまでも進めないでいる。
[H3]3の移植を待ってます…！[/H3]

i did platinum trophy and forgot to do review:
in this game you play as laharl and fight many types of demons while leveling up,upgrading items,reincarnating and attending senate, yes if you played later games they have more mechanics and stuff, but this game STARTED disgaea as a series, so i'll give it a slack.
